Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi, one (of the few) things I used Agama for was sending from a specific address, rather than `""`.  Before I used `z_sendmany`.  
What can I use for this now (cli prefered)?
Only thing I could come up with is importing privkey into an empty wallet and sending from there...

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: you want to send from a specific output ? then you need to use `createrawtransaction` ,  `signrawtransaction` & `sendrawtransaction`

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Cool.  I've only used rawtransactions for CCs.  
Not sure how I'd use them for this purpose.  (not sure what to do to send funds).

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Interested to learn about this.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Will check out the docs.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: If you have any resources I could look at I'd be grateful!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There's many scripts people have written over time that do this, u just need to filter the listunspent correcty

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content:
`komodo-cli help` is where I started with, the template of a `createrawtransaction ` looks like this, you pick the`txid` & `vout`  from `listunspent`
```
komodo-cli -ac_name=NAME createrawtransaction "[{\"txid\":\"xxx\",\"vout\":1},{\"txid\":\"yyy\",\"vout\":4}]" "{\"RReceiver1\":0.4991,\"RReceiver2\":1.3195}"
```

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: it will return a serialized transaction, which you need to sign with `signrawtransaction` then `sendrawtransaction` the signed one

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: usually `RReceiver2` is yourself (change address)

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
I've seen how to use rawtransactions, but it's getting the values that might cause me trouble, haha.
Can see how this will be very useful to learn

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: yes it is very useful, I was forced to learn this to clean my BEER dust 😂

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Haha, the testnet was very useful wasn't it!!

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: sure is

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`but it's getting the values that might cause me trouble`
listunpent and 'getrawtransaction some_hex 1' will be a good friend to you

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: If you already know txid, then getrawtransaction works much better than gettransaction for getting vouts, other info you may want, and amounts

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @phm87 the way pos64 POS works is that it calibrates the POW diff to match the target POS%

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it looks at the previous 100 blocks, if >51 were POS, it lowers POW diff, if >49 were POW, it raises it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: also, I can find you a guide for pos64staker if you like. You should use the `restart` branch of that repo. You'll need to add LABS to the assetchains.json it pulls as well. Let me know if you need any help with it.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: ok I'll try thank you

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
@zatJUM you're on a pretty old build, that was fixed in jl's repo shortly after launch. Any of his branches other than master will work fine. 
`komodo_segid ht.4 couldnt extract voutaddress` can be ignored, it's just printing because there is a tx with no outputs other than OP_RETURN in block 4
